New Records: Zac Gallen struck out 11 batters in six innings.
Pavin Smith hit a three-run homer in the eighth inning.
The Arizona Diamondbacks ended a three-game losing streak with an 8-2 win.
The Diamondbacks are.001 behind the New York Mets for the second National League wild card.
The Braves and Mets had their series postponed due to Hurricane Helene.
Key Match Events: Zac Gallen retired 12 straight batters starting in the second inning and struck out the side in the fifth.
Pavin Smith's three-run homer put the game out of reach in the eighth inning.
The Diamondbacks' offense rebounded after a lackluster performance the previous day.
The San Francisco Giants struggled, striking out 17 times in the game.
Pre-Game Insights: The Diamondbacks needed a rebound after a three-game losing streak that included a blown eight-run lead and a 11-0 loss to the Giants the previous day.
Christian Walker emphasized the importance of the win for the team's confidence.
Diamondbacks first baseman Christian Walker said, 'These matter big-time, I think we had to prove to ourselves to get back on track.'
Post-Match Reflections: Christian Walker expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win.
Diamondbacks manager Bob Melvin acknowledged the team's need to improve their performance.
Giants starter Mason Black struggled, allowing four runs on five hits and five walks.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Diamondbacks are preparing for a three-game series against the San Diego Padres starting Friday.
The San Francisco Giants have not yet named their starter for the opener of their next series against the St. Louis Cardinals.
Others: The article corrected the name of the Arizona pinch hitter from Gavin Smith to Pavin Smith.
